title: Man, 6-year-old girl shot in East Cleveland
content:
(File photo)
EAST CLEVELAND, Ohio -- A man and a 6-year-old girl were shot Thursday night during a dispute between neighbors in East Cleveland, police said.
The shooting happened about 9 p.m. on the 1700 block of North Taylor Road, near Euclid Avenue, East Cleveland police Sgt. Mitchell said. A 67-year-old man and his neighbor, a man in his 20s, got into an argument.
The 67-year-old pulled out a gun and opened fire, Mitchell said.
A bullet struck the girl in the left leg, and the man was struck in his right leg, Mitchell said.
They were both taken to University Hospitals by paramedics. Their injuries are not considered life-threatening. Their current conditions are unknown.
The man who fired at the two victims was arrested, and his handgun was confiscated, Mitchell said.
The investigation into the shooting continues and formal charges are expected to be filed against the 67-year-old man in the coming days.
Residents on the street said that it's not uncommon to hear gunfire throughout the night in the neighborhood, especially past midnight.
"It's the norm. Nothing surprises me," neighbor Star Loving said after learning that a girl was shot. "Bullets don't have names on them."
